intro: Gouania phillipsonii, commonly known as the Philippine gouania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has small, oval-shaped fruits that contain several seeds. Gouania phillipsonii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
